name: Ugali
description: A staple dish in Kenyan cuisine, Ugali is a simple cornmeal porridge, firm enough to be eaten by hand and used to scoop up meat, vegetables, or sauces.
steps: Bring water to a boil in a large pot.
Slowly pour the cornmeal into the boiling water, stirring continuously with a wooden spoon.
Continue to cook and stir until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the sides of the pot.
Turn out the Ugali onto a plate and mold into a round shape.
Serve hot with a stew or vegetables.
tips: Keep stirring the Ugali as it cooks to prevent lumps.
Adding a little butter or oil can give a richer flavor.
Serve with Sukuma Wiki or any meaty stew.
